process_details.description: The Manage Registry business process maintains registries of members with specific conditions, risk factors, or care needs to support population health management and care coordination. Registries enable tracking of member populations, monitoring of care gaps, and targeted interventions.
trigger_events: New registry created for population health initiative.
results: Members added to or removed from registry as appropriate.
Registry reports available for care management.
Care gaps identified for registry members.
Registry data available for population health analysis.
process_steps: Define or review registry criteria and purpose.
Query member data to identify eligible members.
Evaluate members against registry inclusion criteria.
Remove members who no longer meet criteria.
Validate registry data accuracy and completeness.
Identify care gaps for registry members.
Make registry information available to authorized users.
shared_data: Member data store including clinical information
process_details.constraints: Registry criteria must be evidence-based and aligned with clinical guidelines. Registry data must be maintained in compliance with privacy and security requirements. Registry updates must occur with sufficient frequency to support care management activities.
failures: Data quality issues prevent accurate registry population.
Eligible members not identified for registry inclusion.
performance_measures: Percentage of eligible members included in registry
Effectiveness of registry in supporting care management
